benchmark_details.name: Zéroe
benchmark_details.overview: Zéroe is the first large-scale catalogue and benchmark of low-level adversarial attacks in NLP, encompassing nine different attack modes designed to test the robustness of NLP models against realistic attacks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for testing the robustness of NLP models against low-level adversarial attacks.

data.source: Adversarial attacks published in the Zéroe benchmark.
data.annotation: Automatically generated through various attack methodologies.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed by comparing the performance of models on clean data versus attacked data.
methodology.interpretation: Decreases in accuracy and AUCROC indicate vulnerabilities to adversarial attacks.
